nodes.text: Felines, also referred to as felinoids, were a subgroup of mammals that were typified by the following cat-like traits: a very flexible body, slit-pupiled eyes, sharp teeth, a tail, padded, clawed hands and feet, heightened senses, and hunting and tracking instincts. Examples of feline life-forms included non-sentient animals like the tooka, manka cat and tusk cat, and sentient species such as the Cathar, Srrors'tok, Togorians and Trianii.
